# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `cog_del_c`
* Variable label: `Cognition - delayed recall - Continuous`
* Variable description: `Delayed recall of a list previously employed for measuring Immediate recall. The number of words is exactly the same as in the study-specific variable`
* Domain: `Health status and functional limitations`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


* Short name: `cog_del`
* Variable label: `Cognition - delayed recall`
* Variable description: `Delayed recall of a list of common nouns. Discrete variable: value 0 = <=25%; value 1 = >25%.`
* Domain: `Health status and functional limitations`
* Value type: `Categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | <=25%
1        | >25%

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


```{r lab, echo=FALSE}
ds_label <- "Delayed recall"
ds_label_cog_del_c <- "Delayed recall of a list previously employed for measuring Immediate recall. The number of words is exactly the same as in the study-specific variable"
ds_label_cog_del <- "Delayed recall of a list of common nouns. Discrete variable: value 0 = <=25%; value 1 = >25%"
```

# Data process

## Cuba

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

The study-specific variables elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `recall_original`
* Label: `10 word recall before imputation of MV`
* Categories:
   + `Continuous Variable 0-10`
* Missings
   + `NA`


```{r assign Cuba w1, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 's1066_Cuba_w1_cog_del','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline', variables=list('recall_original'), missings = TRUE)
s1066_Cuba_w1_cog_del <- opal.execute(o,'s1066_Cuba_w1_cog_del')
```

```{r local Cuba w1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- s1066_Cuba_w1_cog_del$recall_original
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = "Immediate recall continuous")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(s1066_Cuba_w1_cog_del, aes(x=factor(recall_original))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Cognition - Delayed recall") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del_c` from the study-specific variables you have to sum the total of words and the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del` from `cog_del_c` it has to be recoded as follows:

* `cog_del_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_del_c >25% into 1`

**R script**

```{r harmo Cuba w1}
##cog_del_c

t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=s1066_Cuba_w1_cog_del$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del_c <- car::recode(s1066_Cuba_w1_cog_del$recall_original, "NA=999")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del_c <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del_c, labels = c(Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))

##cog_del
Q <- quantile(car::recode(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del_c, "999=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del <- car::recode(t1066_ds_cuba_w1[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):10=1")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript Cuba w1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del_c
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "Delayed recall continuous")
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("cog_del") + ylab("Frequency")

vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "Delayed recall categorical") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(cog_del))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Cognition - Delayed recall") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation Cuba w1, echo=FALSE}
Continous <- c(sum(na.omit(t1066_ds_cuba_w1[[2]])<=Q), sum(na.omit(t1066_ds_cuba_w1[[2]])>Q&na.omit(t1066_ds_cuba_w1[[2]])<900), sum(na.omit(t1066_ds_cuba_w1[[2]])==999))
Dicotomic <- table(t1066_ds_cuba_w1[[3]], useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(Continous,Dicotomic)
colnames(C) <- c("0:3->0","4:20->1", "NA->999") 
kable(C, caption = "Continuous vs Dichotomous")
```

```{r importOPAL Cuba w1, echo=FALSE}
label(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del_c) <- ds_label_cog_del_c
label(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del) <- ds_label_cog_del
#opal.assign.data(o, 't1066_ds_cuba_w1', t1066_ds_cuba_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'t1066_ds_cuba_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
cog_del <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1
save(cog_del, file = "../RData/cuba_w1/cog_del.RData")
rm(cog_del)

t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1 <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1
t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del <- car::recode(t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del, "c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997,998, 999)=NA")
t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del_c <- car::recode(t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1$cog_del_c, "c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997,998, 999)=NA")
#opal.assign.data(o, 't1066_m_ds_cuba_w1', t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del_c` from the study-specific variables you have to sum the total of words and the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del` from `cog_del_c` it has to be recoded as follows:

* `cog_del_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_del_c >25% into 1`

**R script**

```{r harmo UrbanChina w2}
##cog_del_c
t1066_ds_UCh_w2 <- tibble(id=s1066_UrbanChina_w2_cog_del$id)
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$cog_del_c <-  car::recode(s1066_UrbanChina_w2_cog_del$f_recall_original,"NA=999")
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$cog_del_c <- labelled(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$cog_del_c, labels = c(Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))

##cog_del
Q <- quantile(car::recode(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$cog_del_c, "999=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

t1066_ds_UCh_w2$cog_del <- car::recode(t1066_ds_UCh_w2[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):10=1")
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$cog_del <- labelled(t1066_ds_UCh_w2[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

**R script**


```{r harmo UrbanMexico w1}
##cog_del_c
t1066_ds_UM_w1 <- tibble(id=s1066_UrbanMexico_w1_cog_del$id)
```

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

The study-specific variables elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `recall_original`
* Label: `10 word recall before imputation of MV`
* Categories:
   + `Continuous Variable 0-10`
* Missings



```{r assign PuertoRico w1, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 's1066_PuertoRico_w1_cog_del','10-66.1066-PuertoRico-Baseline', variables=list('recall_original'), missings = TRUE)
s1066_PuertoRico_w1_cog_del <- opal.execute(o,'s1066_PuertoRico_w1_cog_del')
```

```{r local PuertoRico w1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- s1066_PuertoRico_w1_cog_del$recall_original
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = "Immediate recall continuous")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(s1066_PuertoRico_w1_cog_del, aes(x=factor(recall_original))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Cognition - Delayed recall") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del_c` from the study-specific variables you have to sum the total of words and the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

To compute the harmonized variable `cog_del` from `cog_del_c` it has to be recoded as follows:

* `cog_del_c <=25% into 0`
* `cog_del_c >25% into 1`

**R script**


```{r harmo PuertoRico w1}
##cog_del_c
t1066_ds_PR_w1 <- tibble(id=s1066_PuertoRico_w1_cog_del$id)
t1066_ds_PR_w1$cog_del_c <- car::recode(s1066_PuertoRico_w1_cog_del$recall_original, "NA='999'")
t1066_ds_PR_w1$cog_del_c <- labelled(t1066_ds_PR_w1$cog_del_c, labels = c(Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))

##cog_del
Q <- quantile(car::recode(t1066_ds_PR_w1$cog_del_c, "999=NA"), probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)

t1066_ds_PR_w1$cog_del <- car::recode(t1066_ds_PR_w1[[2]], "0:Q=0; (Q+1):10=1")
t1066_ds_PR_w1$cog_del <- labelled(t1066_ds_PR_w1[[3]], labels = c("<=25%"=0, ">25%"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

# Quality estimation

There were two variables: "recall_original" with missing values, and "recall" where missing values were subsequently imputed.
The harmonized variable is based on "recall_original" for consistency with other studies which did not impute recall data.
